With the use of films, tapes, and kinescopes it will be possible
to test the materials and media biases in several geographic
areas and grade levels at once. And many people have expressed
interest in testing such experimental materials in their schools
and colleges. Here the results achieved, with different orientations,
from various types of projects, of different grade levels, and
in different geograohical locations, a working document will
be prepared on thejrfabasis of which the organization of material
for subsequent re-checking and final reporting, editing and
distributing, will be developed.
In other cases different groups will be used in agiven location.
Where possible,control groupings alread y available for onÂ¬
going studies will be used. In other cases such groupings will
have to be established on the basis of known sex, intelligence
and reading readiness, emotio nal and parental back ground,
religion, and other data available.
In all cases emotional, sensual, kinesthetic, attitud inal,
and subliminal ,as well as purely intellectual and fact-transmission
changes willbe sought outin the new testing techniques to be
evolved. Attitude and inter-action effects, among students,
and between students and teacher, will be observed and recorded
for later study, analysis and elaboration in the texts being
developed.
Cooperation in developing testing materials has been offered
by various stations and institution s in the U.S.,as well as
by the CBC, which has offered its facilities, and research
department cooperation, without charge, for this purpose. Tantative
locations for demonstration-experiments, from which invitation*
have already been received, now include St.Paul, Boston, NewYork,
and Urbana, as well as schools in Canada. Cooperation in
preparing materials has also been offered by Andr^ Girrard ,
distinguished artist, who is now experimenting with word and
image at CBS and NBC.. This project has also been submitted,
in draft form, to various other media experts, including Dr.Henry
Cassirer, of UNESCO, who is preparing a book o n educational
television. The enthusiastic cooperation of these scholars
is also assured.
